ygData.subject: Open Question Re: Significance of Composition of Generation Zero

Subject: Open Question Re: Significance of Composition of Generation Zero
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=281645563; y=aZkvpcdmUoAMAz9QCm2kn9PjQCflHZQgrCd90NE8aXpkJg

Ken,

The environment definately shapes the path of evolution (i.e. the 
ty=
pes of problems you attack shape the weapons you use). Easy 
problems rarel=
y manifest the weak links in the chain. The weak links 
in NEAT presently (=
IMHO) are as follows (not exhaustive):

a) selection of composition of gene=
ration zero,
b) static-valued parameter set accross generations and problem=
s,
c) ad-hoc parameter set determination,
d) no infrastructure to evaluate/=
quantify performance/efficiency of 
individual sub-systems,
e) redundant co=
verage of limited portion of design space,
f) limited coverage of design sp=
ace,
g) no rational basis to justify "e" and "f" above (except luck and 
fa=
ith in NEAT method),
h) premature complexification of genome structure prio=
r to 
appropriate coverage of design space at infant/lower level of genome =

structural complexity to justify additional complexification (at a 
given =
stage of evolution),
i) no mechanism to incorporate prior knowledge of geno=
me structure,
j) no mechanism to incorporate prior knowledge of fitness sur=
face,
k) no mechanism to remember or benefit from where you have been in 
t=
he design space,
l) no restart capability,
m) no mechanism for recursive op=
eration,
n) no mechanism to implement trained genome or network as a node,
=
o) no mechanism to implement node transfer functions which require 
more th=
an one unique input and/or output.

As stated previously, NEAT is metaphori=
cally a wheel. A wheel is a 
wonderful thing to appreciate. But they are so=
 much more useful when 
you put them on a car along with all the other nuts=
 and bolts that a 
car requires to make it go from point "A" to "B" in a pr=
oductive and 
reliable manner.

Data previously posted is sufficient for th=
e willing and able.

Based upon my observations, with infrastructure in pla=
ce to make the 
observations, the benefit/justification is not "maybe at be=
st double 
the efficiency", but rather between one and two orders of magnit=
ude.

Regards,
Andy Carl

ms).   It appears that if you 
manage

t paying a different cost for

ver, I am not sure

n the cost of

tation

are "conservative."

 rates?

> ken

otential to handle practical real-world problems until these

fter which it

e=
valuation

nefits of 
the

arch 
required
